eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: 4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Parallax
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Behaviors to animate Tiled Sprite objects in the background, following the camera with a parallax effect.
description: Behaviors to animate Tiled Sprite objects in the background, following the camera with a parallax effect.
Breaking changes
- The parallax now starts with an offset of 0.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move the image of a Tiled Sprite to follow the camera horizontally with a parallax effect. After adding this to an object, put the object on a layer that is not moving, behind the layer that is followed (for example, a layer called "Background").
eventsBasedBehaviors.fullName: Horizontal Parallax for a Tiled Sprite
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: HorizontalTiledSpriteParallax

propertyDescriptors.label: Parallax factor (speed for the parallax, usually between 0 and 1)
propertyDescriptors.name: ParallaxFactor

propertyDescriptors.label: Layer to be followed (leave empty for the base layer)
propertyDescriptors.name: FollowedLayer

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move the image of a Tiled Sprite to follow the camera vertically with a parallax effect. After adding this to an object, put the object on a layer that is not moving, behind the layer that is followed (for example, a layer called "Background").
eventsBasedBehaviors.fullName: Vertical Parallax for a Tiled Sprite
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: VerticalTiledSpriteParallax

propertyDescriptors.label: Parallax factor (speed for the parallax, usually between 0 and 1)
propertyDescriptors.name: ParallaxFactor

propertyDescriptors.label: Layer to be followed (leave empty for the base layer)
propertyDescriptors.name: FollowedLayer

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetState

eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

propertyDescriptors.name: PressedLabelOffsetY

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/) and Entropy (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClvkb12nOWFgWnQ56NF9Rcw)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShadowClones
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Create and animate shadow clones that follow the path of a primary object.
description: Select the primary object, the shadow clone object, the number of shadow clones, the number of frames between shadow clones, the rate that shadow clones will reduce opacity and size (if desired), the Z-value and the layer the shadow clones will be created on.
This extension can be used to:
- Make an object look faster, such as during a speed powerup.
- Give a 3D-like feel to a character
- Implement unique time-based elements, like teleporting a character back to a previous location
- Simulate the movement of a caterpillar or slinky
- Recreate games like snake or tron
These object variables are provided to manage the shadow clones:
- ShadowCloneOrder: Shadow clone identifier, where 1 is the shadow clone closest to the primary object
- FramesBehindPrimary: The number of frames that the shadow clone is behind the primary object
Notes:
- For shadow clones to work, this action must be run every frame.
- The ShadowCloneObject cannot be the PrimaryObject, but it can be a duplicate object.
- For animations to work, the PrimaryObject and ShadowCloneObject must use the same animation numbers.
Watch this [tutorial video](https://youtu.be/2t4ANYgrrak) to see examples of how to use this extension.

eventsFunctions.description: Select the primary object, the shadow clone object, the number of shadow clones, the number of frames between shadow clones, the rate that shadow clones will fade away (if desired), the Z-value of the shadow clones, and the layer the shadow clones will be created on.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Animate shadow clones that follow the path of a primary object
eventsFunctions.name: AnimateShadowClones
eventsFunctions.sentence: Create and animate _PARAM3_ copies of _PARAM2_ that follow the position of _PARAM1_, with _PARAM4_ empty frames between shadow clones, and fading the opacity of shadow clones by _PARAM5_ per clone.  Shrink scale of shadow clones by _PARAM6_ per clone. Shadow clones will be created on _PARAM7_ layer with a Z-value of _PARAM8_.  Match X scale: _PARAM9_  Match Y scale: _PARAM10_  Match angle: _PARAM11_  Match animation: _PARAM12_  Match animation frame: _PARAM13_  Match vertical flip: _PARAM14_ Match horizontal flip: _PARAM15_

Create shadow clones and link them to the primary object

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Entropy
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AdvancedJump
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Sports and Fitness/Sports and Fitness_training_running_run.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Let platformer characters: air jump, wall jump wall sliding, coyote time and dashing.
description: This extension provides behaviors to:
* Jump in mid-air
* Jump and slide against walls
* Dash horizontally
* Dash toward the floor

* Do coyote time, also known as "ledge tolerance". It lets players jumping even after their character is no longer touching the ground for a given amount of time. It aims to give players a feeling of control and reduce frustration.
An example allows to check it out ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer-moves)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let platformer characters jump shortly after leaving a platform and also jump in mid-air.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: AdvancedJump

events.comment: Avoid any side effect if the feature is not used.
The timeframe is starting.
The timeframe is missed.
Coyote jump
The new value will be used next frame.
While in the coyote jump frame, the Object is treated as being on the floor. No air jump can happen.
When the object fall, it doesn't jump but air jumps must be allowed

The order of these events is important because the idle state is:
on the floor and jump key released but the 1st jump must not count.
Reset air jump counter.
Allow air jumps.
Coyote time was disabled, so WasInTheAir may not have been updated for a long time.

eventsFunctions.description: Change the coyote time duration of an object (in seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: SetCoyoteTime

events.comment: Coyote time was disabled, so WasInTheAir may not have been updated for a long time.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let platformer characters jump and slide against walls.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: WallJump

events.comment: Avoid a jump from the floor to do a wall jump because of the allowed timeframe.
Reset default character configuration when a jump that is not a wall jump happens (for instance an air jump).
To know when jumping from the floor or not.
Reset default character configuration when the character change of direction or start to fall.
When the character tries to move but can't actually move, it's against a wall.
Save the previous position for the wall detection.

To be permissive, when the jump key was pressed right before the character touch the wall,
it is still detected as a wall jump which reset the air jump counter.
